Nepali: भविष्य में तुम्हारी मदद की उम्मीद है
English: I hope to have your help in the future

Nepali: मैं भी तुम्हारी मदद करना चाहता हूं
English: I also want to help you
this way, this place (polite form of "koko")

Nepali: त्यो बाटो, तपाईँको नजिकको स्थान (पोलीत सो)
English: that way, this place near you (polite form of "soko")
that way, that place far away (polite form of "asoko")
which way, which place? (polite form of "doko")
department, sales counter (in a department store)

Japanese: ～でございます。 (polite equivalent of です)
～を みせてください。 ～を 見せて ください।

English: rest, a holiday, a day off
That's tough, isn't it? (used when expressing sympathy)

Japanese: おといあわせのばんごう

English: which day of the month, how many days
a little while, a little bit
Excuse me./Anybody home?/May I come in? (an expression used by a visitor)
How nice of you to come. (lit. Welcome.)

Japanese: どうぞおあがりください

English: Thank you./May I? (lit. I'm afraid I will be disturbing you.)
Won't you have [~]?/Would you like to have [~]? (used when offering something)
Thank you./I accept. (said before starting to eat or drink.)
cold (referring to touch, as a drink)

Nepali: काम, व्यवसाय (～おしさす: काम गर्न, काम गर्न)
English: work, business (～おしさす: do one's job, work)

Pronunciation: Nihon no seikatsu ni narimashita ka.
Japanese: 日本の生活に慣れましたか。

Nepali: अहिलेर सुनेको म दुःख पो छ। / मलाई दुःख लाग्यो
English: I'm sorry (to hear that)./That's a pity.

Japanese: いっしょにいかがですか。

English: [~] is a bit difficult. (an euphemism used when declining an invitation)

Japanese: またこんどおねがいします。
English: Please ask me again some other time. (when refusing an invitation indirectly, considering someone's feelings)
a fixed place to catch taxis, trains, etc.
the ~th shelf (dan is the counter for shelves)
Welcome./May I help you? (a greeting to a customer or a guest entering a shop, etc.)
So long. (lit. Go and come back.)
So long. (lit. I'm going and coming back.)
sushi (vinagered rice topped with raw fish)
tempura (seafood and vegetables deep fried in batter)
flower arrangement (～をします: practice flower arrangement)
meeting, conference (～をします: hold a conference)
Let's do that. (used when agreeing to someone's suggestion)
bowl of rice topped with beef

Pronunciation: おしえます［じゅうしょを～］

English: how to read, way of reading
right (used when encouraging some course of action)

Pronunciation: しんごうをみぎへまがってください。
Japanese: shingou o migi e magatte kudasai.

Pronunciation: これでおねがいします。
English: I'd like to pay with this.

Japanese: すんでいます［おおさかに～］

English: quit or retire from [a company], stop, give up
[No,] I still have a long way to go.

Japanese: 亡くします (無くします)

English: doctor (used when addressing a medical doctor)
a few ~ (~ is a counter suffix)
Take care of yourself. (said to people who are ill)

Nepali: बजाउनु (तार युक्त यन्त्रमा वा पियानोमा आदि)
हो रे! (आश्चर्य व्यक्त गर्दा प्रयोग हुन्छ)

English: pinball game (～をします: play pachinko)

Nepali: कहिल्यै होइन, कहिल्यै हुन्न (नकारात्मकसँग प्रयोग हुन्छ)

English: Thank you. (used when expressing gratitude for help received.)

Nepali: आहारको नियमिती (～をします: आहारको नियमितीमा जानु)
English: diet (～をします: go on a diet)

Nepali: म (पुरुषहरूको लागि आफ्नोबाट आपत्तिहीन ढंगले प्रयोग हुने वाक्यांश)
English: I (an informal equivalent of わたし used by men)

Nepali: तपाईं (पुरुषहरूको लागि आफ्नोबाट आपत्तिहीन ढंगले प्रयोग हुने वाक्यांश)
English: you (an informal equivalent of あなた used by men)

Nepali: श्री (पुरुषहरूको लागि आफ्नोबाट आपत्तिहीन ढंगले प्रयोग हुने वाक्यांश)
English: Mr. (an informal equivalent of ～さん used by men)

Nepali: हो (हालती ढंगले प्रयोग गरिएको अनौपचारिक रूपमा हामीले व्यक्त गर्ने)
English: yes (an informal equivalent of はい)

Nepali: होइन (हालती ढंगले प्रयोग गरिएको अनौपचारिक रूपमा हामीले व्यक्त गर्ने)
English: no (an informal equivalent of いいえ)

Nepali: यहाँ, यहाँको तर्फ (अनौपचारिक ढंगले प्रयोग गरिएको)
English: this way, this place (an informal equivalent of こちら)

Nepali: यहाँ, त्यहाँको तर्फ (अनौपचारिक ढंगले प्रयोग गरिएको)
English: this way, that place (an informal equivalent of そちら)

Nepali: यहाँ, त्यहाँको तर्फ (अनौपचारिक ढंगले प्रयोग गरिएको)
English: this way, that place over there (an informal equivalent of あちら)

Nepali: कुनै (दुई वस्तुहरूको मध्ये), कुनै तर्फ, कुन ठाउँ (अनौपचारिक ढंगले प्रयोग गरिएको)
English: which one (between two things), which way, where (an informal equivalent of どちら)
Are you going back to your country?
speech (～を します:make a speech)
side job (～を します:work part time)
talk, speech, what one says, story (～を します:talk, tell a story)
There is no other choice. / It can't be helped.
It's been a long time (since I last saw you). / Long time no see.

Japanese: おめでとうございます。
English: Congratulations. (used on birthdays, at weddings, New Year's Day, etc.)
That was delicious. (Said after eating or drinking)

Japanese: おじいさん/おじいちゃん
おばあさん/おばあちゃん

English: transfer (～します: be transferred to another office)

Japanese: [いろいろ]お世話になりました
English: Thank you for everything you have done for me.
Best of luck. (said when expecting a long separation)
